note.p: Education: MD (1779, King's College, Aberdeen); LCP (1793)
Career: Surgeon in the Royal Navy; Physician, Greenwich Hospital (1790-1806; 1814-1819)
Licentiate, Royal College of Physicians, London: 179-
References: G C Cook, 'Richard Dobson Kt MRCS FRS (1773-1847) and the inferior status of naval medicine in the early nineteeth century: End of the Fleet physicians' in NR 2005 pp 35-43
